intro: Trifoliastrum, commonly known as the three-leafed vine, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Bignoniaceae. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. The flowers are typically showy, often in clusters, and can range in color from yellow to orange. These plants are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. They are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and can thrive in a variety of soil types with adequate sunlight.
